Getting reb4j

There are a number of ways to obtain and use reb4j.

Using Maven

reb4j is available from the open source software Maven repository provided by Sonatype, which is periodically synchronized with the Maven Central repository, so if you are using Maven to drive your project build, you can build against reb4j just by adding a dependency to your POM:

<dependency>
        <groupId>net.sourceforge.reb4j</groupId>
        <artifactId>net.sourceforge.reb4j</artifactId>
        <version>1.1.0</version>
        <scope>compile>
</dependency>

If you want to access the latest snapshot build, or if you are too impatient to wait for Maven Central to sync (which happens hourly), you should add the Sonatype repository to your settings.xml file:

<repositories>
        <repository>
                <id>sonatype-nexus-public</id>
                <name>Sonatype Nexus Releases and Snapshots</name>
                <url>https://oss.sonatype.org/content/groups/public/</url>
        </repository>
</repositories>

Downloading

In addition to being available via Maven, the latest release of reb4j can always be downloaded directly from the Maven repository from this location: https://oss.sonatype.org/content/groups/public/net/sourceforge/reb4j/
